title: Freezing the Display
content:
## What It Does

Freeze Display captures the current projected image and holds it static:
- The projected image stays frozen
- Your computer screen continues updating normally
- The audience sees a "snapshot" of what was displayed

## When to Use

**Ideal situations:**
- Pause a video while explaining a concept
- Keep a slide visible while navigating to other content
- Hide your desktop while opening files or applications
- Review a specific frame without replaying video

## How to Use

1. Click the **Freeze Display** button (light blue)
2. The projected image freezes immediately
3. The button changes to **Unfreeze Display**
4. Continue working on your computer (audience won't see changes)
5. Click **Unfreeze Display** when ready to resume

## Keyboard Shortcut

Press **Ctrl+F** to toggle freeze on/off.

## Important Notes

> **⚠️ Warning:** While frozen, the audience cannot see what you're doing on your computer. This includes mouse movements, new windows, or any content changes.

> **Note:** The projector lamp remains on - this is NOT a power-saving feature. Use **Blank Screen** for breaks.

> **Tip:** Freeze is perfect for "hiding" your notes or speaker view while presenting.
